intro: Conchocarpus gaudichaudianus subsp. bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia conchocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
